Indeed.
The WoWs steam edition is just a strange idea in my opinion.

I’ve found I’m good at brawling in WoWs. Destroyers are the best class for me. The high speed and high maneuverability are great for getting into torp range then fleeing. It’s satisfying nailing a full salvo of torps bringing an almost full hp ship down to Davy Jone’s locker.

I’ve had a two battles going up against battleships where diving head first towards a battleship actually worked.

There was a South Carolina exiting a channel and was getting ready to destroy me, thinking it was the end and trying to shave off some hp, I charged that battleship and from a close distance launched all starboard torps and planned to whip around to fire port torps AND to my surpise, I got him.

 

In open waters I got caught within 1km of a South Carolina and had dumped all my torps in previous engagements and was waiting on a reload. Before he was sunk, a st.louis had gotten my propulsion leading me to get pretty close to the wreck. 30ft from this South Carolina on the relaid, I kept trying to see if I could get torps on him and I got the reload before he did and sunk him.

On 2/3/2019 at 10:47 AM, munlander1 said:

I’ve had a two battles going up against battleships where diving head first towards a battleship actually worked.

There was a South Carolina exiting a channel and was getting ready to destroy me, thinking it was the end and trying to shave off some hp, I charged that battleship and from a close distance launched all starboard torps and planned to whip around to fire port torps AND to my surpise, I got him﻿.﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿

Got my first seven-kill match before Kraken was even a thing in open beta, and it was a Clemson. That thing has insane burst firepower due to dual cannons and torps on either side, so not only did I wipe the floor with, AFAIK, three destroyers in the opening seconds, I later yolo’ed into two Wyomings - which pay for the extra two turrets over South Carolina by being hilariously long - and annihilated them in seconds as well.

It gets worse once cruisers with torpedoes show up; you can use either ambush tactics or disruptive long-range barrages. The T3 Tenryu is essentially a giant destroyer with centremounted long-range torpedoes.

It gets even worse when sonar (guaranteed detecton, torps included) and radar (guaranteed detection in smoke) become available.

Nevertheless, compared with open beta, I can rarely score hits at 7 km. Looks like people have learned not to steam in a straight line.

Edited February 4, 2019 by DDE

7 hours ago, DDE said:

It﻿ gets﻿ even worse when sonar (guaranteed detecton, torps inclu﻿ded) and radar (guaranteed detection in smoke) become available.

 

What’s the range on those?

59 minutes ago, munlander1 said:

“Engaging a cruiser. No need to worry about torps”

*hears the horrible sound of the torp alarm*

What’s the range on those?

3-5 km for a sonar, 100 sec long activation.

Radar works for about 20 sec with a range of 9-12 km.

Also note that any aircraft drastically increase the odds of early torp detection. Before the current weird aircraft carrier system, unoccupied fighter squadrons would be moved into torpedo watch positions.

You guys ever have a game where you have no idea how you survived? I just had one of those. Was cornered by a Kaiser and a Courbet. I had already gotten the Kaiser with a few torps and had got some flooding going. I had to saturate him the torpedoes to get the few hits I did. My steering gear is then knocked out and I beach myself. I start shifting in and out of full forward and full reverse while poping smoke. Idk if it was their long reload time or what, but the shells weren’t flying. Kaiser succumbs to the flooding (caused by me). I got my steering gear back and pull out .5-1km from the Courbet. Launch torps off my portside then turn to starboard for another launch. I sunk him and managed to survive with like 5hp.
